titleStmt.title: B. A. Seaver to James R. Page
CWG2239

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
Mt. Sterling Ky Oct 31, 1865
Jas R Page Esq.
Asst. Secty of State
Dear Sir,

Please send the commission for Thomas Metcalfe Esq. Police Judge at Mt Sterling as soon as possible directed to him all charges will be forwarded on receipt (See page 281 1st Vol. Acts, 1865). Send also one ^Sect. 16^ copy Stanton's Revised Statutes (last Ed.) one code of Practice (Stanton's last Edition) & the Acts of the General Assembly passed since the adoption of Revised Statutes (see page 279. 1st Vo. Acts 1865 Sect. 9). Send the latter to Trustees of Mr. Sterling

Very Respy.
B. A. Seaver
City Atty.
Police Judge
Books
Sent on the 3d Nov/65.
